sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set after repeating the removal of the middle third portion n times, where n is a positive integer?
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set does not change after repeating the removal of the middle third portion n times, where n is a positive integer. The Hausdorff dimension remains constant and is given by the formula:

Hausdorff dimension (D) = log(N) / log(S)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and S is the scaling factor.

For the Cantor set, N = 2 (as it is divided into two equal parts after each iteration) and the scaling factor S = 3 (as each part is one-third the size of the previous interval).

So, the Hausdorff dimension (D) of the Cantor set is:

D = log(2) / log(3) â‰ˆ 0.6309

This value remains constant regardless of the number of iterations (n) performed.
